name: Aishwarya Thiruvengadam
content: HomeSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationAishwarya ThiruvengadamI am currently an Assistant Professor at the Department of Computer Science, IIT Madras. My research interests lie broadly within cryptography and theoretical computer science. My recent works have focused on provable security of symmetric-key cryptography.Previously, I was a postdoctoral scholar at the Department of Computer Science, TU Darmstadt working with Prof. Marc Fischlin as part of the Cryptoplexity group. Prior to that, I was a postdoctoral scholar at the Department of Computer Science, University of California Santa Barbara working with Prof. Stefano Tessaro. I obtained my PhD from the University of Maryland, College Park where I was advised by Prof. Jonathan Katz and Prof. Dana Dachman-Soled.Professional Service:Program Committee member for CRYPTO '18, CFAIL '20Publications:Provable Time-Memory Tradeoffs: Symmetric Cryptography against Memory-Bounded Adversaries.Stefano Tessaro and Aishwarya Thiruvengadam.TCC 2018.
